story.overall_description: The video series documents a residential renovation project executed by 'HARPEN CONSTRUCTION'. The narrative spans the full scope of work: cutting trim in the front yard, installing white railing on a back deck, and laying 'TrafficMaster' laminate flooring throughout the living areas. The footage provides a comprehensive view of the occupied private residence, the contractor's equipment, and specific installation techniques.

cross_clip_threats.title: Definitive Business and Job Site Identification
cross_clip_threats.why_amplified_across_clips: The 'HARPEN CONSTRUCTION' logo is a constant visual anchor across all clips. When combined with the exterior street view (Clip 1), the backyard layout with a bystander (Clip 2), and the specific interior floor plan (Clips 3-5), this creates a publicly verifiable record linking the business to a specific client address.
cross_clip_threats.evidence_summary: 'HARPEN CONSTRUCTION' logo + Street view + Work truck + Interior layout.

cross_clip_threats.title: Client Privacy and Security Exposure
cross_clip_threats.why_amplified_across_clips: The video exposes the interior and exterior security of a private home. Clip 1 shows the front entry, Clip 2 shows the rear access, and Clip 5 details interior transition points (doorways). The presence of a resident in Clip 2 further highlights the privacy intrusion into an occupied home.
cross_clip_threats.evidence_summary: Front and rear entry points + Interior doorways + Resident bystander.
mitigation_ideas: restrict filming to work areas only

cross_clip_threats.title: Material Specification and Cost Profiling
cross_clip_threats.why_amplified_across_clips: The sequence detailing the flooring installation (Clips 3-5) identifies the specific product ('TrafficMaster Lakeshore Pecan') and installation method. This allows for a precise estimation of the project's material costs and quality tier, which is sensitive commercial or personal financial information.
cross_clip_threats.evidence_summary: TrafficMaster packaging + Specific installation tools (pull bar, tapping block).

clips.scene_summary: The worker walks from the kitchen (new flooring) through the living room, out the front door, down the porch steps to a white work truck. They retrieve a long piece of white trim from the truck, carry it back to the porch, and place it on a miter saw stand.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Directly identifies the business entity and likely the wearer's employer.
detections.evidence_rationale: Logo clearly readable on the chest when looking down.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Reveals the private living space of a third party (the client). Specific decor and layout are visible.
detections.evidence_rationale: Walkthrough of living room and kitchen area.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Unique vehicle identifier linked to the business or individual owner.
detections.evidence_rationale: Rear plate of the white truck visible as doors are opened.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Shows neighboring houses, street layout, and parked cars, allowing for geolocation of the job site.
detections.evidence_rationale: View from the front porch looking out at the street.
Red and silver saw set up on a stand in the yard.

clips.scene_summary: The worker moves to the back deck/patio area to install the white trim piece. They measure and fit the railing. A male resident is seen walking in the background. The worker uses a DeWalt drill.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Capture of a person in their private backyard without explicit consent (implied by the candid nature).
detections.evidence_rationale: Man walking across the deck in the background.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Reveals the rear layout of the property and proximity to neighbors, aiding in geolocation.
detections.evidence_rationale: Wide view of the deck and fence line.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Identifies tool assets, consistent with professional contractor equipment.
detections.evidence_rationale: Yellow drill used to secure the railing.
Logo visible on shirt as worker bends over.

clips.scene_summary: The wearer is inside the house, opening a box of laminate flooring with a utility knife. They begin laying the planks on the floor. The specific brand and model of the flooring are clearly visible on the packaging.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Identifies the specific product and supplier (TrafficMaster is a Home Depot exclusive brand), revealing material costs and sourcing.
detections.evidence_rationale: Brand name 'TrafficMaster' clearly visible on the cardboard box.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Specifies the exact aesthetic choice and SKU of the renovation material.
detections.evidence_rationale: Text 'Lakeshore Pecan' visible on the box end.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Maintains the link between the interior flooring work and the exterior construction seen in previous clips.
detections.evidence_rationale: Logo on shirt visible while working on the floor.

clips.scene_summary: The worker is kneeling on the new floor, using a tapping block and hammer to secure the laminate planks together. The 'HARPEN CONSTRUCTION' logo is visible on their shirt as they work.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Continuous identification of the contractor during the installation phase.
detections.evidence_rationale: Logo visible on chest while tapping the floor.
Close-up of tools being used to join planks.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Further reveals the interior condition and layout of the client's home.
detections.evidence_rationale: Background view of the room being floored.

clips.scene_summary: The worker continues installing the laminate flooring near a doorway transition. They use a metal pull bar and hammer to tighten the joints of the final planks. The work truck and tools are briefly visible through the doorway.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Demonstrates specific installation technique for tight spaces.
detections.evidence_rationale: Close-up of tool being hammered to close the gap.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Provides detailed architectural information about the home's interior layout and flow.
detections.evidence_rationale: Framing of the shot includes the door jamb and adjacent room.

detections.why_privacy_sensitive: Maintains the business identification throughout the final clip.

meta.generation_notes: The final clip completes the renovation narrative. The persistent exposure of the business name and the client's home interior constitutes the primary privacy profile of this story.
